subject: Re: [junit] ant1.7 with junit4.4
msgSnippet: Never mind, its working now ... It was just a stupid classpath issue. ... [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
messageBody:
Never mind, its working now ... It was just a stupid classpath issue.


On 3/29/08 7:27 PM, "Anurag Dial" <anuragdial@...> wrote:

>
>
>
> Hi,
> I've been using Ant 1.7 and junit 4.x to create reports for a long time now.
> I don't think there is any such in-compatibility.
> May be the details of the error you are facing might got you some help from
> the members of the group.
>
> Thanks,
> Anurag.
>
> On Sat, Mar 29, 2008 at 3:02 AM, Pranav <vpranav@...
> <mailto:vpranav%40yahoo-inc.com> > wrote:
>
>> > Can we use Ant 1.7 with junit4 to create test reports. I am able to
>> > execute
>> > my junit 3.8 tests with ANT 1.7, and reports also get created properly.
>> > but
>> > the moment I use junit 4.4 , it starts throwing error. I searched on net,
>> > and got a feeling that may be ant 1.7 is not fully compatible with
>> > junit4...
>> > Is it true ?
>> >
>> > Best,
>> > Pranav
>> >
>> > [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>> >
>> >
